sentence.Network_en: People used to recoil from the idea of getting into debt.
sentence.Network_cn: 过去人们不能接受欠债这种事情。

sentence.Network_en: His reaction was as much of a rebuff as a physical recoil.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的反应既是身体的退缩，也是一种断然的拒绝。

sentence.Network_en: We are attracted by nice smells and recoil from nasty ones.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们会被好闻的味道吸引，难闻的味道则会让我们退避三舍。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (denoting the act of retreating): from Old French reculer 'move back', based on Latin culus 'buttocks'

entry.def: If something makes you recoil, you move your body quickly away from it because it frightens, offends, or hurts you.

example.ex: For a moment I thought he was going to kiss me. I recoiled in horror...
example.tran: 我当时以为他要亲我，所以吓得直往后退。

example.ex: We are attracted by nice smells and recoil from nasty ones.
example.tran: 我们会被好闻的味道吸引，难闻的味道则会让我们退避三舍。

entry.tran: （因为不喜欢而）拒绝，回绝，退避
entry.def: If you recoil from doing something or recoil at the idea of something, you refuse to do it or accept it because you dislike it so much.

example.ex: People used to recoil from the idea of getting into debt...
example.tran: 过去人们不能接受欠债这种事情。

example.ex: She recoiled at the number of young girls who had to live by selling their bodies.
example.tran: 那么多年轻的女孩不得不靠出卖肉体谋生，她觉得难以接受。

entry.def: The recoil of a gun is the quick backward movement that it makes when it is fired.

example.ex: The policeman fires again, tensed against the recoil, unleashing round after round at his assailant...
example.tran: 警察再次开火，紧抵着反冲机构，不断向袭击他的人射击。

example.ex: I assembled the weapon, checked the firing and recoil mechanism and loaded it.
example.tran: 我把家伙组装起来，检查了一下击发和反冲机构，装上子弹。

means.word_mean: 1. the backward jerk of a gun when it is fired
2. a movement back from an impact
1. draw back, as with fear or pain;

sentences.sentence: "she flinched when they showed the slaughtering of the calf"

means.word_mean: 2. spring back; spring away from an impact;

sentences.sentence: "These particles do not resile but they unite after they collide"

means.word_mean: 3. spring back, as from a forceful thrust;

sentences.sentence: "The gun kicked back into my shoulder"

auth_sentence.content: As he approached...he found time to wish he could recoil.
auth_sentence.res_content: As he approached...he found time to wish he could recoil.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: As he approached...he found time to wish he could recoil.

auth_sentence.content: Some will recoil at these triumphalist claims for free-market capitalism.
auth_sentence.res_content: Some will recoil at these triumphalist claims for free-market capitalism.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Some will recoil at these triumphalist claims for free-market capitalism.

auth_sentence.content: Dark energy creates coil, expansion, recoil.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Dark energy creates coil, expansion, recoil.

sentences.en: Howard recoiled a little at the sharpness in my voice.
sentences.cn: 听到我的尖声，霍华德往后缩了一下。

sentences.en: As he leaned towards her she instinctively recoiled.
sentences.cn: 他向她靠近，她本能地往后缩。

sentences.en: Anna recoiled in horror as the snake approached.
sentences.cn: 那条蛇逼上前来，安娜吓得直往后退。

sentences.en: Most people would recoil at the sight of the snake.
sentences.cn: 许多人看见蛇都会向后退缩。

sentences.en: His wily plan recoiled on him.
sentences.cn: 他狡猾的计划反害了他自己。
